meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or serving as a genitive.
meanings.sent1: The possessive form of the noun is genitival.
meanings.sent2: In English, 'of the book' is a genitival construction.
meanings.sent3: The genitival cat claimed ownership of the yarn ball.
meanings.sent4: Her genitival nature shone through in her caring gestures.
meanings.sent5: The genitival relationship between the two characters was evident in their shared secrets.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or being a genitive construction.
meanings.sent1: The genitival phrase 'of the king' adds detail to the sentence.
meanings.sent2: Linguists study the structure of genitival constructions.
meanings.sent3: The genitival garden gnome guarded the flowers with pride.
meanings.sent4: His genitival style of writing added depth to the story.
meanings.sent5: The genitival touch of gold on the painting made it stand out.
